CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper August 26, 1967, pg. 15, reads: "Art - Design Studio Open - The Artist - Harold Meredith Neal who met his pretty little wife in Carnegie Museum when they were both studying in the pre-college classes, stands beside an unfinished portrait of their daughter Deborah.  He has many handsome canvases hanging on the walls of Pittsburgh homes. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Harold Meredith Neal standing next to his painting of his daughter, and figurative wooden sculpture, in his home
